laboratory_examinations.findings: Demonstrated a subepithelial bulla, inflammatory infiltrate of T and B lymphocytes, and linear deposition of IgG and C3 consistent with paraneoplastic ocular cicatricial pemphigoid (POCP).
Disclosed subepidermal bullae and mostly T cells with virtually no B cells in the dermal infiltrate.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Peripheral blood smear and flow cytometry
laboratory_examinations.findings: Marked lymphocytosis of typical B-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) cells.
Disclosed extensive subepidermal bulla formation with an edematous superficial dermal reaction.
Demonstrated a pattern consistent with paraneoplastic pemphigus (PNP) involving antibodies binding murine bladder and a complex of 4 cytolinker proteins.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The condition has continued to deteriorate.
